data.title: Reset screen resolution when quitting
data.body:
OpenRA does not reset the screen resolution after game exit (at least not with my setup). Everytime I quit the game, I have to reset it manually in my OS settings, which is a little annoying. It would be very helpful, if OpenRA could restore the initial desktop resolution when quitting.

Platform: Ubuntu Linux with KDE
Using Cg renderer
Fullscreen mode
Desktop resolution: 1280x800
Using resolution: 800x600

data.title: Allies 01 fixes
data.body: Misc Allies 01 fixes

data.title: packaging: .nsi has vestigial package download junk for all mods
data.body: Should be removed

data.title: Offset is wrong for most d2k buildings
data.body:
Now that I added the turrets and bibs it becomes obvious that the building offset is somehow wrong. The only unaffected building is the silo and the walls. For the turrets only the placing is rendered above the square which will get back into it's tile after being placed. I tried to fix it with

```
RenderBuilding:
      Origin: 0, -12
```

but this will only desync place and actual placement even more. I guess it's tilesize related, but I could not figure out where to fix it myself.

data.title: low priorities: pack the cs files in the oramap
data.body: In future, it would be easier for modders if all the files for missions are included in the oramap files. Then it's easier to mod and receive new missions

data.title: update changelog(0315,0504,0630,...)
data.body: links to changelogs can still be found in irc logs

data.title: close server with password
Chrono: no palette effects, sounds, on return
Invuln: Need some indication of how much time is left
Chrono: need some indication of how much time is left before return
Chrono: passengers not killed on return
data.body: Passengers are only getting killed on the initial teleport, not the return.

data.title: Spy capture sign on tech center not working
data.body: The spy capture sign on tech center is wrong, not the same as the other buildings

data.title: Crash when creating host using "allow pnp port forwarding"
data.body:
Using playtest 6/30 on a mac:

$ uname -a
Darwin iMac.local 11.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 11.4.0: Mon Apr  9 19:32:15 PDT 2012; root:xnu-1699.26.8~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

The game crashes after clicking on 'create'.
# Exception log:

---

data.title: RALint does not care about missing sequences
data.body: To prevent issues like #2195.

data.title: per-user network statistics
data.body:
Finally getting a match with a lot of players to start, only to find out the game lags as hell is a pain in the ass. Therefore it would be useful to be able to view the latency in relation to the host and/or packet loss per player before and/or during a match.

In the long term the problems with lag could probably be fixed in the network code, but as a workaround these statistics would be very welcome addition.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/98187-per-user-network-statistics?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixes issue #2277
Fixes issue #2277
data.body: LoadSound should never crash if a file is not found.

   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()

data.title: Harvester fixes - one crash fix, one behavioral fix
Harvester fix to obey player move/stop order
engineers that do not enter the building on capture
data.body: If we imitate the http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Capture_building feature from C&C Generals the engineer will be vulnerable during the capture process and is not wasted by it. This way you still have a chance to avoid the capture otherwise the countdown is useless because the building is already neutral and you can't do anything against it. The beep sounds, getting a flag out of a suitcase animation and riflemen replacing the engineer in Generals are not worth copying however.

data.title: More fixed music strings
data.body: A couple music strings were wrong. I corrected them

data.title: Fixed music strings
data.body: I fixed some music strings, more to come.

data.title: Allies 01 polish
data.body: Map polish

data.title: Fixes issue #2267
data.body: Fixes issue #2267. Water will not be smudged/scorched any more from nukes. All resources in range of nuke are destroyed now, not just the ones on the edge of the circle.

data.title: Fixes issue #2256: zombie aircraft flying around beyond death
data.body: `FallsToEarth.NotifyKilled` calls `Cancel` method in `FlyAttack`, and that method was not nulling out `NextActivity` in the event of a double-cancel on a frame where the aircraft was killed by a missile. The `FallToEarth` activity queued up from `FallsToEarth.NotifyKilled` got pushed deep into the queue which then got canceled at some later point.

data.title: Fixes issue #2256: zombie aircraft flying around beyond death
data.body: `FallsToEarth.NotifyKilled` calls `Cancel` method in `FlyAttack`, and that method was not nulling out `NextActivity` in the event of a double-cancel on a frame where the aircraft was killed by a missile. The `FallToEarth` activity queued up from `FallsToEarth.NotifyKilled` got pushed deep into the queue which then got canceled at some later point.
